content: The App is okay. The only problem is, you allow Sellers that send wrong items. I ordered Jean and i received Pink Purse. After i rate the Seller i see that there are many reviews same as my review. It seems that the seller intentionally send wrong items for bigger profit. Since theres no warranty. And you cant report scammer Sellers . I hope you add a system to remove those Scammer Sellers like a Report Seller Option. Please work for this. We are paying right for the wrong item.

When you refund an order. It goes into your wallet which you then have to request to go back onto your credit card. You cannot use money in wallet unless you're Thai. Also the money then takes a long time to get refunded so if they don't do it I won't remember. The whole thing is scammy, bad business practices. Will not use them anymore to shop.

Very easy shopping though almost everything is false advertising. Showing huge discounts but discounted price is actually the srp or prevailing market value of the product. Advertising buy 1 take 1 but price is double the price of one. Advertising "Original" but actually "OEM" in description especially for foot wears. Advertising "free shipping" but when you place your order, a shipping fee will be added on top of price. Wew. But app is good.

There's a condition where the customers are harmed. Lazada doesn't provide deadline for the seller to send the product. I have experienced this myself.

Lazada does not have a good process for wrong items received. Lazada only allows a return process to commence after order is updated to "Delivered." To get this status takes 15 days after an item is shipped, even if you receive it in 2 days. Your alternative is to contact seller to update the status. This app is a bloated memory hog, slow to load (sometimes not at all) in some sections, and its interface is NOT intuitive at all. I install and use it ONLY if I have active orders that need to be tracked, especially when I'm on the road/outdoors. Otherwise, it's uninstalled. You'd think that with the profits they're generating they'd see the wisdom in investing more on app development, either by hiring better people and/or giving existing developers better compensation. These days, there's simply no excuse for subpar apps when they're coming from (in this case) an online retail giant. Who knows? They probably don't feel compelled to make "quality of life" adjustments to this app because..., well, they're an online retail giant. My advice: Use it if you need to track orders while away from your desktops. Otherwise, keep it uninstalled. XD

The app is cluttered and not very reliable. The main issue for me personally is, that you can not see previous orders as they simply disappear. This makes ordering the same product again (let's say coffee) a chore. Also, there is little guarantee that one will receive the product ordered. Shops offer things they don't have and then try to manipulate the buyer into ordering something else, usually more expensive. And don't even try to return a faulty or wrong product. It is impossible. I received an item in the wrong color after two weeks of ordering, returned it the same day and have been waiting for seven (7!) weeks for a service to pick it up. In the meantime I have complained three times to Lazada, only to be (re-)assured that the next time it would work. Well, seven weeks... and nothing. That is absolutely shameful.

Significantly slower than the browser experience. (Takes a long time to load items and my orders.) Has constant and obnoxious app notifications throughout the day. (Your voucher is expiring! Your voucher is expiring! 285 days to go before your voucher expires! Sale now! Sale now! Your voucher is expiring!) I could turn off notifications, but then I wouldn't get DELIVERY notifications, and with the slower response time than the browser experience, there is no point keeping the app on my phone.
